newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-DAUGHTER'S HEALTH FORCED SAUNDERS TO QUIT TURKEY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-DAUGHTER'S HEALTH FORCED SAUNDERS TO QUIT TURKEY.

text.p: Welsh international striker Dean Saunders said on Thursday that fears regarding his five-year-old daughter Louisa's health prompted him to quit Turkish club Galatasaray halfway through a two-year contract.
Saunders, who moved to English premier league Nottingham Forest in the close-season, explained: "Louisa suffers with asthma and in Istanbul in the winter people burn cheap fuel which causes a smog.
"Needless to say that didn't help her at all and she ended up in hospital suffering with pneumonia and bronchitis.
"When I saw Louisa with her chest wired up to a machine and an oxygen mask on, I really knew it was time to head home.
"It was a worrying time for us all and really that convinced me to leave Galatasaray. I had still 12 months to go of my contract but the club were very understanding."

Saunders, whose daughter has since made a full recovery, has made a slow start to life at Nottingham with one goal in the opening eight league matches but still feels his spell in Turkey has made him a better player.

He said: "I learnt a great deal out there. They play with man markers, something I'd only ever experienced before when with Wales. It took me a while to adapt, but I'm sure the experience is standing me in good stead."
